data.title: Typical Chinese buffet
data.text: Nothing special. The food is OK. Good variety, however, good deserts. The decor is kind of nice, however it is aging. Great location downtown. Seems to be a favorite of college students especially on weekends.

data.title: Downtown Chinese Buffet
data.text:
A tired restaurant with mediocre food.  There was good variety on the buffet which one would expect, however several of the selections were not warm at all, others were rather chewy as though the food had sat on the warming table for quite a while.

The decor of the restaurant is very dated and worn.  The service, well they took your money as you walked in and they did remove used plates from your table, but that was about all that was done.  Floors were greasy feeling in places.  Restrooms were filthy dirty and the floor was extremely slippery.

Probably will not return to this restaurant unless renovations are made.

data.title: Good food, bad environment...do NOT use the restrooms
data.text:
My family loves going here.  It's at least twice a month.  I'm ND born and raised, so my taste buds don't know the difference.  The dishes are hot and fresh, the staff are attentive.  By big issue is the environment.  Each time I fear leaving with a foodborne illness....if they can't even have the bathrooms functional, what must the kitchen look like?
My kids know the bathrooms are totally off limits there.
Needless to say it could use updating because the dusty poinsettias around the goldfish pond and the wobbly tables that are stabilized with towels are just tacky.

data.title: The buffet is well attended too.
data.text: I usually eat here a couple times a year when I'm down town. It's quick and very reasonably priced. Great value place for lunch.

data.title: Satisfies the Chinese Food craving
data.text: Always hot and seemingly fresh when I hit this place for a quick lunch.  Seems weird that they are usually cleaning green beans next to the cash register but at least I know they are fresh.  Decent value, always full when I leave.

data.title: Good Eats For Those On A Budget
data.text:
Took the entire family here for dinner. Décor is very nice for a buffet restaurant, including a Koy pond that had huge fish swimming around. The grandkids loved that.

The food is pretty standard fare though, which was a little disappointing. Not to say the food wasn't good, just expected a little better selection considering that the King House is an all buffet joint. 

Most of the selections were chow mein, lo mein, lots of noodle type dishes. Very big salad bar selections. The one disappointment I guess, was that many of the dishes were just lukewarm, considering they were right off the steam table.There was also an ice cream machine for dessert.

The staff were very friendly and helpful, with one of the servers offering to take a picture of my grandkids and myself looking into the Koy pond.

Not a bad experience by any means, just not a great one either. If you're downtown Fargo and on a budget, this place will do just nicely for a filling dinner.

data.title: The food on the buffet was not hot or even warm
data.text: I didn't expect much from this place, but I was still disappointed. All of the "hot" dishes on the buffet were luke warm or cold. I tried several things and all were kind of room temperature. Then I actually looked carefully for an item that had steam rising from it. The only one I found was the lobster roll, but when I put one on my plate and felt it, the actual roll was not hot, not even warm. The food here may have been good, but I couldn't bring myself to do more than taste a little of the various dishes because the luke warm/cold temperature grossed me out. I complained to the cashier (you pay before you eat, maybe this is why) on my way out, and he was very nice about it and said that he was sorry and would check into it. Maybe it was just a problem they were having this particular day. I didn't ask for a refund and he didn't offer. To be fair, there were a dozen or so other customers eating here, and I didn't see anyone else complaining, so maybe those people didn't mind the room temperature buffet food. Personally, I found it unappetizing.

data.title: Very good, place needs a little updating.
data.text: Great food and great service. The place could use dome updating though. Food was hot and delicious. They offer Lobster rolls that are out of this world.

data.title: Dissapointing at best
data.text: The King House used to be one of my favorite Chinese restaurants, but my latest trip there has changed that. My husband and I decided to go there on a lunch date. The food was standard Chinese buffet food, however the quality has gone down hill. The chicken in the 4 different chicken dishes I tried lacked actual meat and was more breading than anything. Not to mention, all 4 options tasted basically the same. Not looking forward to another trip.

data.title: Lotsa choices, not too tasty
data.text: Well, as expected there's lots of food and it's well-presented.  I found most dishes to be very bland, however.  Also, the dining area decor is very outdated.

data.title: One of my favorites
data.text: As a local I have eaten here many times, and it is one of my favorite places to dine. The price is average and the buffet offers tons of options: many Chinese dishes of course, a few American options, a full salad bar, ice cream and drinks. The evening price is higher and includes coconut shrimp and crab legs. The coconut shrimp is definitely one of my favorites, even though I detest coconut. The only problem is the crab legs are rarely refilled and you are lucky to ever get any. I usually spend much of my visit eyeing the buffet to see if crab legs are refilled, and I usually leave disappointed.

data.title: A Local Place With Great Food
data.text: It's Chinese food done well in Fargo, ND. The building is a bit run down but the service is anything but. Warm, friendly, family staff make sure the King House is the same as it ever was and what it ever was is worth a visit every chance you get. The buffet is always great and take out offers many options you don't get other places.

data.title: King House Buffet
data.text: Hungry for Chinese?  This is the place you need to go.  Several items to choose from, salads, fruits, desserts, beverages, specialties, soups, everything you could want and then some.

data.title: Ok food, bad service
data.text: My fiancee loves eating here and I'm normally reluctant because of how dirty it looks but today we decided to eat here. Food was ok, typical Americanized Chinese food, but the service we got was horrible. My sister found a hair in her food and instead of an apology and them asking what they could do for us they asked how long we had been here. I don't know how long we've been here but I'm pretty sure the hair was there much longer. We stopped eating and I'm pretty sure this will be the last time we eat here until I hear things have improved.

data.title: Chinese food for everyone
data.text: This restaurant has a theme to its interior like all Chinese food places, its not brand new. However their food is great and you can sit in a both or a balcony or even close too a window too see whats going on outside...The staff will keep your table clean and remove empty plates when you finish a selection..The food I consider is very good. They have what most Chinese restaurants serve Pork,beef,chicken,shrimp,crab and fish and of coarse the two rices and  chow mien....The difference with this restaurant and others is the oils they use when frying. The oils are very light and hardly noticeable..Actually I have tried other restaurants with a Chinese food and they use too much oil and it affects the taste of the food......The staff here do not speak much English, so you as a diner will not be bothered by staff wanting to know if food is okay.. Two prices one for lunch and one for evening..Discounts for Seniors..Their salad is basic except they serve pea`s in the shell which you do not find often and they taste as if they were just picked from garden.....Enjoy singles,couples,family everyone is welcome...Its my favorite here in Fargo......

data.title: Just dont.
data.text: Food was not fresh. Egg rolls cold in the center. It felt as if we went to a soup kitchen, but the soup was inedible.......I had a rusty salad off the buffet and saved room for "second dinner". May be fine if you are a college student on a budget, but if you care in the least about quality or flavor. Just don't go.

data.title: Crap service.
data.text: DON'T ORDER OFF THE MENU! They pick the stuff off the buffet line and serve it to you at twice the cost.  The place is dirty and run down. I will never go there again.

data.title: Lobster rolls are great and all the food was hot and tasty
data.text: The buffet here is awesome.  You have to get the lobster rolls.  They do a good job of serving hot food here and the price is reasonable as well. Happy to visit here again.

data.title: Needs improve
data.text: Nice food, but sometimes it is not fresh and they load it with black pepper to cover this but it is very obvious. Also, needs to improve the cleaning of the place. Most interesting is the food smell in the air is very strong and stick to your cloths for week if you did not wash it. Nice ice cream. The machine of Pepsi is not working sometimes and the drink tast horrible if happen. Very wide variety of food which is not available in other Chinese restaurants. Very friendly stuff and always smiling which makes me go there often because my 5 years kid like the icecream there and the waiters smile to her and be nice to her, and she aware of that. The resturant has some offers and cheap too.

data.title: Buffet heaven
data.text: This is a buffet. Its not a chic boutique dining experience. If you like buffets this is a good one. Lots of fresh fruit and veggies too and for some reason I just love their hard boiled eggs. I like the open seating and atmosphere and the food is good.
